text: Aleksandras Antipovas (born 9 March 1955 in Bogdanyu, Soviet Union) is a retired Lithuanian long-distance runner who represented the USSR under the name Aleksandr Antipov. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1977 |World Cross Country Championships |Düsseldorf, West Germany |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Team |- |rowspan=3|1978 |European Championships |Prague, Czechoslovakia |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |10,000 m |- |rowspan=2|World Cross Country Championships |rowspan=2|Glasgow, Scotland |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Long course |- |align="center" | 4th |Team |- |rowspan=2|1979 |rowspan=2|World Cross Country Championships |rowspan=2|Limerick, Ireland |bgcolor="cc9966" align="center" | 3rd |Long course |- |align="center" | 4th |Team |- |rowspan=2|1980 |rowspan=2|World Cross Country Championships |rowspan=2|Paris, France |align="center" | 6th |Long course |- |align="center" | 5th |Team |- |1982 |World Cross Country Championships |Rome, Italy |bgcolor="cc9966" align="center" | 3rd |Team |} == External links == * * * Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Lithuanian male long- distance runners Category:Soviet male long-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1980 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of the Soviet Union Category:European Athletics Championships medalists
title: Aleksandras Antipovas
